title: Ausreisser Font
content:
I just saw the short film Ausreisser and wondered what font font they used for the beginning titles. The sample is awful, I admit, but its unfortunately all I have. The “R” is distictive for it’s jointed leg like the ’R’ in closefont’s Hybrid. As always any help appreciated.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006164919im_/http:/typophile.com/files/austreissier%20sample.jpg)

 [‹ (x) "Graphic designer" child-like script - Fig Script {Patricia}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006164919/http:/typophile.com/node/18657 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "It's a cafe on wheels" italic - ITC Garamond {Mark S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006164919/http:/typophile.com/node/18655 "Go to next forum topic")
author: James Gareth

comments.content: I’m bumping this for another look or suggestion. Anyone know where I can get a better sample?
Isn’t it DIN 1451 or something ? Lower case **l** looks like a hockey stick.
